DataElement.preferredName: Trunk And Extremities Soft Tissue Sarcoma AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Trunk And Extremities Soft Tissue Sarcoma Pathologic T Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The body excluding the head and neck and limbs._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Body limbs, consisting of right upper and lower (arm and leg) and left upper and lower (arm and leg). (CADSR)_A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: TL released; 2/24/22.; 4-2-19 created for AJCC Ed. 8; tmt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma Trunk And Extremities American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities with tumor measuring more than 15 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities with tumor measuring more than 15 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities with tumor measuring more than 10 cm and less than or equal to 15 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities with tumor measuring more than 10 cm and less than or equal to 15 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities with tumor measuring more than 5 cm and less than or equal to 10 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities with tumor measuring more than 5 cm and less than or equal to 10 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities with tumor measuring 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities with tumor measuring 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pT0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities pTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Trunk and Extremities TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of soft tissue sarcoma of the trunk and extremities, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
